newsitem.title: TAIWAN: China Steel July-Feb pretax down 16 pct.
newsitem.headline: China Steel July-Feb pretax down 16 pct.

text.p: China Steel Corp, Taiwan's largest steel maker, said on Monday it posted a pretax profit of T$10.447 billion between July 1996 and February 1997, down 16 percent from T$12.429 billion from the same period a year ago.
Its July-February sales slid to T$55.119 billion from T$56.514 billion the year-earlier period, the company said in a statement.
China Steel's February pretax profit was T$1.154 billion on sales of T$6.168 billion, up from February's 1996's pretax profit of T$814 million and sales of T$6.014 billion, it said.
China Steel, previously state-run, was privatised in April 1995.
